title: 94/189/EC: Commission Decision of 18 March 1994 on financial contribution from the Community for the eradication of classical swine fever in Germany (Only the German text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 18 March 1994 on financial contribution from the Community for the eradication of classical swine fever in Germany (Only the German text is authentic) (94/189/EC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
For outbreaks of classical swine fever which have occurred during the months of July, August, September, October, November and December 1993 Germany may obtain Community financial assistance. The contribution by the Community shall be:
- 50 % of the costs incurred by Germany in compensating owners for the slaughter and for destruction, as appropriate, of pigs and pig products,
- 50 % of the costs incurred by Germany for the cleaning, disinsectization and disinfection of holdings and equipment,
- 50 % of the costs incurred by Germany in compensating owners for the destruction of contaminated feedingstuffs and contaminated equipment.

1. The Community financial contribution shall be granted after supporting documents have been submitted.
2. The documents referred to at paragraph 1 above shall be presented by Germany at the latest six months after notification of this decision.

The Community shall follow developments in the situation regarding the disease and, if necessary, evolution, shall adopt a new Decision in accordance with the provisions laid down in Article 3 (4) of Decision 90/424/EEC.
This Decision is addressed to the German Republic.
attachments:
